history.content:
I'd personally recommend side projects or club projects. 61B projects are great, but they're naturally pretty structured compared to any projects you do outside of classes. Plus, you can list any personal projects on your resume/Github/LinkedIn, which can provide a good talking point assuming you want to direct your "software engineering skills" towards industry.

That said, if you're lost on where to start, looking ahead to 61C/upper division projects or trying to look into how to construct BearMaps from scratch might give you inspiration on what makes a good software engineering project.

When I took 61B last spring I did all the assignments except for bearmaps and BYOW. I was wondering, how weak might my software engineering skills be by not tackling these projects? Would these holes be better improved through doing the projects again or tackling my own side projects?
history.subject: 61B software engineering questions
